meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the presence of water.
meanings.sent1: The hydromorphic soil near the river was always damp.
meanings.sent2: The plants in the hydromorphic area thrived due to the constant water supply.
meanings.sent3: The hydromorphic ground seemed to enjoy the frequent rain showers.
meanings.sent4: Her hydromorphic garden was a lush paradise after the heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent5: The hydromorphic landscape painted a picture of tranquility with its water features.

meanings.definition: Having a structure or form influenced by water.
meanings.sent1: The hydromorphic rocks along the coast were smooth from years of water erosion.
meanings.sent2: The hydromorphic design of the building prevented water damage during floods.
meanings.sent3: The hydromorphic sandcastle stood strong against the incoming tide.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, styled in hydromorphic waves, looked effortlessly beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The hydromorphic sculpture captured the fluidity and grace of water perfectly.

meanings.definition: Showing adaptation to wet or waterlogged conditions.
meanings.sent1: The hydromorphic plants in the marsh had developed special roots to survive.
meanings.sent2: The hydromorphic animals had webbed feet to navigate the flooded areas.
meanings.sent3: The hydromorphic shoes kept his feet dry even in the heavy rain.
meanings.sent4: Her hydromorphic coat repelled water, keeping her warm and dry.
meanings.sent5: The hydromorphic frog leaped effortlessly through the waterlogged terrain.
